Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ferrariwa
Reviews.Content: Have stayed a number of times at this hotel, mostly for its great location. The nearest tube (Gloucester Road, zone 1/2) is a 5 minute walk on a busy main road, while others are 10 minutes. Good Points are its proximity to some of Londons most attractive sites, including natural history museum (10/15 minute walk and a few others) and Harrods (20-25 minute walk). If you dont fancy the walk, a quick tube ride and your there within minutes. For convenience there is a Sainsburys across the road, and a waitrose next to the station plus a tesco/starbucks/burger king. Bad Points are the hotel itself, sadly it has deteriorated over the years since my first visit. The rooms as people mention are extremely cramped, even the double ones when your paying three figures for a nights stay! The most abysmal part was the bathroom, which even a child would struggle for space! Although my most recent visit was off season (double room for £60), I could believe my ears at the amount of traffic noise that was filtering through the windows. Despite many attempts to resolve this, I gave up and accepted a lack of nights sleep. As the hotel is on a busy main road you are fighting a losing battle here. I did try to change the room but was advised any room will experience the same problem and it doesnt look they are in a rush to sort it out! In summary if you are not bothered about hotel quality and value but want the convenience then its a good place to stay otherwise look at the other dozen hotels nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Janet061
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked into 2 rooms for 5 nights - after our 1st choice was being renovated. The front desk people looked as us as if we had two heads whenever we asked a question. Both rooms were small and a long way from each other, when the rooms were finally ready we found the housemaid being yelled at, in one of our rooms, by her supervisor and she was in tears. Breakfast was included and each morning we were confronted with staff arguing (not in English) across the room. Wifi was not available in our rooms - we went to the lounge room and we had no connection - the front office weren't helpful at all and about half an hour of asking them to check, they finally resetted the server and it worked!!!! There were two positives for this hotel - its proximity to the underground and the day we left!!. Go somewhere else if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Swing a cat, no chance.”
Reviews.Author: Mart_traveller
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this for one night at the last minute for £120 for the night room only. First appearance of the building and look of reception was great as were the very friendly front desk staff but the room - oh dear. Arms outstetched my fingertips touched both walls. A double bed was sqeezed in and was against the wall so someone on that side had to climb over the other person to get out of the bed. The flex on the kettle didn't reach from the table it was on to the plug socket below so we had to put the kettle on the floor. The kettle didn't fit under the tap in the tiny sink in the miniscule en-suite so we had to fill it by decanting water with multiple fills of the toothbrush mug. The windows were sash, single glazed, rattled, were drafty and let in all the 24 hour traffic noise from Cromwell Street below. I tried to deaden the noise by wetting towels and shoving them over the gaps but to no avail. Breakfast was nice but we had to pay extra for that. I suppose this place sells a rubbish, cramped noisy room like this on the basis of the location but no - a room is rubbish no matter where it is and if you can't plug in the kettle whoever designed it should be fired.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sparky T
Reviews.Content: If you think this hotel is a local charming place as you'd think it is from the online advertising, you'd be very disappointed. The rooms are very tiny, even for European Standards. The bathroom is even more so - you can shower, brush your teeth and relieve yourself all at the same time !!! It takes 5+ minutes for hot water to show up in the shower, and when it does, you'll wind up with water all over the bathroom because they don't have anything to keep it from flying around - no curtains, no doors, just a cheap pane of acrylic. The Holiday Inn and Mariott are both just a few doors down from this place ... go there if you're a business traveler !!!! Why did I give it a two rating? Because the staff does seem to try hard, even though the manager seems to be a bit of a pain to them.

Reviews.Title: “Location yes, bathroom no, staff no.”
Reviews.Author: PaulineBelgium
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights (end of Octobre 2011). I booked this hotel because the hotel I normally book in London was full. The room was very basic, but ok. The bathroom (the shower) was not very hygienic and very small. The staff was very rude. I don't recommend this hotel, it was very basic (which can be ok) but having a filthy shower makes it a NO. The staff isn't the most important thing in your hotel, but if you don't even get a spontaneous 'hello', it is quite sad.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean but quite small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Charles D
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancÃ©e stayed four days in that hotel on the end of 2011 September. Our room was quite small and have no safe, but was clean and fresh sheets was provided daily. Furniture is quite old too. Breakfast was good and staff was very nice. The great advantage of this hotel is its location, near a good supermarket, shops, restaurants and tube station. Our room was oriented to the side street and has almost no noise at night, allowing us to sleep very well.

Reviews.Title: “Better than others for the price point”
Reviews.Author: AMcD0524
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in October 2011. Being that I moved onto a comparable but utterly disappointing hotel for the weekend, I can assure you that it is better than others charging similar prices. The cons: Pay for the internet - their "free" wireless does not work. Save yourself the frustration of trying. The rooms are not very cool. I could at least open the windows and there was a small fan, but I am glad I came for the tail end of the heatwave. Small rooms. This is London though, so get used to it. All in 1 conditioner/soap/shampoo. Why do places even bother providing this? Is there anyone for whom this does not instantly turn their hair into straw? FINALLY - if you offer a wake up call, and someone requests a call for 6, calling at 6:14 is not appropriate. If you cannot effectively run this service, don't offer it. 15 min can make a huge difference. Of course, for my final morning when I pre-emptively ordered an EARLIER wake up call seeing that they had called late all week, they naturally called before the time that I had even requested. This is unacceptable. Pros: I found the rooms clean, the beds comfortable, the shower-head was appropriately HIGH, great water pressure, functioning TV, good breakfast selection, good location - well connected to both Gloucester Rd and Earls Court. In short, it is not a great hotel, but it is typical of the hotels in that price range, and the pros were ultimately more important than the cons for me. Ex. I am staying at a hotel now with a shower-head that is 5 feet off the ground. I would rather sort out late wake up calls than crouch to even get my face clean.

Reviews.Title: “Plain and functional but beware noisy road”
Reviews.Author: wingostar
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night. The room was basic but not uncomfortable. Carpet could have been cleaner and in the (small)bathroom the tile grouting was badly discoloured and the seal in need of repair. No aircon and opening windows let in the relentless roar of Cromwell Road which was busy with traffic all night. Even closing the single glazed window didn't help much. Breakfast decent. Overall cheap but not terribly cheerful, just lacking atmosphere and doesn't live up to the sheen suggested by its website photos.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest bathroom I've ever used.”
Reviews.Author: ajw1967
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in July whilst working in the area. Room was adequate, decent sized clean bed. I was fortunate to have a room at the rear as my colleague who was at the front found it difficult to sleep with the traffic noise. The en suite was laughable. I have a larger bathroom in my touring caravan! There was a gap of 12 inches between the sink and wall to squeeze through to get to the very small shower. I had to stand in the bedroom and lean over to shave in the sink. The staff were friendly, especially the ladies who look after breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “London's only hot day, and no AC!”
Reviews.Author: tnwaltz
Reviews.Content: Our room was so tiny we could hardly get our suitcases in. Since it had been a warm day, the room was stifling, even with the window open. The bathroom had about two square feet of standing room. We had made reservations online and didn't realize that it wasn't equal to what we'd had earlier at the Cromwell Best Western across the street for about the same price. (They were already booked for these nights.) I would not recommend it, due to the small size, but certainly not in the summer when it might be hot. The men at the front desk were not rude but certainly were not understanding nor would they refund us for the next night. (That was in keeping with their cancellation policy.)

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: philfatkid
Reviews.Content: Our holiday didn't get off to a good start, we had book a double room and a single room, i rang up the hotel 2 weeks previous to ask if they had any interconnecting, rooms to be told they didn't ( it turned out they did ) but i was told our rooms were next to each other. When we checked in we discovered the romms weren't even on the same floor, my son is 16 and has Aspergers, and this was going to be the start of a new part of his life ie in his own room etc, but this was just not possible with the rooms being where they where. We had to go out and buy a blow up bed for my my son so he could sleep in the double room. The hotel staff said there was nothing they could do as they were full, but said i should have got the name of the person i spoke to !!! All they offered us in compensation was 2 free breakfasts. As for the rooms, the double room was adequate but noisy, the single room was the smallest i have ever been in, and faced into a internal square that had glass at the bottom and lights that stayed on all night. The breakfast room was to small for all the hotel guests, breakfast was good though, and the staff tried to be helpful. In conclusion, pay a bit extra and stay at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: craigbert
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied with our stay at this hotel. It looked to be the best deal we could find for the section of town where we wanted to stay. We were in room 105, I think. The room was nothing fancy. We had a king-sized bed which was two twin mattresses pushed together. The room was tiny; not much bigger than the bed. Tiny TV. Small bathroom. The door on the tub/shower was broken/missing, so you couldn't help but get water everywhere. It was a bit noisy (street noise), but we slept well enough. We were happy to have found something clean and fairly comfortable within our price range. The WiFi in the lobby was free. Pay WiFi was available in the rooms, but we were able to get a weak signal from the lobby. We really found the location convenient; close to Gloucester Road Underground Station and the three lines, shopping, museums, etc. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Small”
Reviews.Author: Patinca29
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room and, though I'm used to much smaller European rooms, the size of this one still took me by surprise. It was barely wide enough for the twin bed and I was just able to turn around in the shower (which had a broken door). My room was facing a very busy street and with no double pane, it was very noisy all night long. I loved the location, but I won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Price not worth accommodation”
Reviews.Author: GiulyJules
Reviews.Content: Very low standard compared to other 3 star hotels in London. The price does not justify the size of the standard double room and the tiny en suite bath with minute basin and moldy bath/shower tub. There was a very small wardrobe (1m width) with the safe at the bottom which could not be opened completely due to the small space. There was no arm chair (only a small chair ) and there were no drawers. The only window of the room faced onto a closed alleyway with walls covered in water / air pipes. From the elevator to the room there were 4 fire doors, a narrow staircase with a dirty carpet. It is clear the Kensington Rooms building was definitely not born as a hotel, but seems to have been flats which were then renovated and transformed to a â€˜hotelâ€™.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at any cost!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie10018
Reviews.Content: The hotel's website makes out that this is a modern, comfortable place but don't be fooled! The website claims that the hotel has a special arrangement with a local David Lloyd leisure centre so guests can purchase special rate day passes. Wrong: when I arrived at the hotel, I was told that no special passes are available at the moment as the hotel is renegotiating the deal. The room I was given (single) is probably the smallest I have ever stayed in: I could touch the sides! The TV screen was smaller than my laptop screen; so much for a relaxing night in watching TV. When I went to the reception to ask for a bigger room with a bigger TV I was told that the hotel was full and all the TVs are the same size anyway. My room was on Cromwell Road, which is busy 24/7, so with the old single glazed windows it felt like sleeping on the road, even though I was on 3rd floor. The room was worn and dirty, bed lumpy and linen old. One electric socket was unusable and possible unsafe as it had half of a plug stuck inside. The sink was nearly blocked and took ages to drain. The only positive aspect about the stay was the breakfast which was plentiful and ok quality (compared to a standard greasy spoon english breakfast). All in all, this hotel is a total ripoff. Avoid at any cost!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: mg3pg3
Reviews.Content: We followed a 3 start recommendation from travelocity for this hotel...what a joke! After walking up to the door and seeing hotel staff sitting on the steps outside the door smoking, we should have known this wasn't going to be good! The hotel photos on the web-site are totally deceptive. This place is a dump! We "checked" in and got the "key" yes an actual key - and the photos on the key looked like it was a hooker hotel. After getting in the tiny "lift" we finally found our room after climbing 6 or 7 steps and then decsending another 6 or 7. The place was filthy - bathroom extremely tiny and the door to the bathroom was scrated and scraped from bumping up against the bed. We left in disgust and are fighting for a refund. I would have flown home before staying in this dump. Go to the Holiday in on Cromwell instead. Small but clean rooms. That's a real hotel. Don't bother with this place. You'll be really sorry.

Reviews.Title: “A Caravan would have been bigger”
Reviews.Author: Janenoz
Reviews.Content: I'll start off saying the good point of this hotel. It is quiet central, down the road from the tube station, close to several shops and restaurants etc. However, having requested a quiet room, we were given what has to be the worlds smallest hotel room I have ever seen. There was a double bed jammed up against a wall and apx 1 foot of room on the other side and end of the bed. When myself and my husband were both standing in the room at the same time, we could not pass each other. The bathroom was a joke. When sitting on the toilet your knees are hitting the sink. When bending over to wash your hands your bum hits the door behind you and to get into the shower you need to limber up for a few minutes before to twist and contort your body sideways to shimmy into it. Trying to use shower gel or shampoo your hair results in your elbows being knocked off the sides several times. Getting out of the shower there is absolutely no room to dry yourself. The double bed had a severe dip in the middle. This hotel is definitely not worth the money. It is really not the place you want to be heading back to after a long day sightseeing in London. My advice is to steer clear of this place and spend the extra few pounds and stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana32
Reviews.Content: Caution!!! We stayed in this hotel two days ago. Yesterday when we check out an old receptionist ask for money for the prepaid breakfast and he was very angry when we try to explain politely that we've payed in cash already. It was 5 o'clock in the morning on Sunday and it was impossible to evoke the manager. So, they charge my credit once again. Be careful, ask for invoice for every pound spent in this hotel, they are thieves, they can do whatever they want with your credit card!!!

Reviews.Title: “not chic, not quality”
Reviews.Author: scotsmantravelling
Reviews.Content: Beware the hotel web site's suggestion that this is a cool, urban oasis with quality rooms. It's a tarted up old hotel on noisy Cromwell Rd, that's had a lick of paint, some very cheap new carpet (in bedrooms - hall is better in order to impress walk-up visitors I suppose) but nothing else. Horrible, realy, really cheap bed 'linen' and pillows, threadbare towels, little sachets of 'body wash' and old analogue TVs. The bathrooms are ancient and the windows are single-glazed old units. There is no wifi or broadband connection in the rooms. Good points? There are three: 1) room was a good size. 2) location is excellent for transport and visiting London attractions. 3) plenty of hot water. But I paid Â£95 for an upgraded room (through a late bookings site) and would never pay that again for the actual quality on offer here, and the total lack of amenities. I was glad to get out of the scratchy sheets and nylon carpeted room. Honestly - Travelodge is better and more honestly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Far Better than I had hoped”
Reviews.Author: kimkirby9
Reviews.Content: Was a bit aprehensive about this Hotel as couldn't believe how reasonable the price was considering we were staying in Kensington and after reading some other reviews ... however location was FANTASTIC, 2 mins from Gloucester Rd Tube Station, down street from Natural History Museum etc etc. Staff very pleasant, breakfast great value, room fantastic size and not box as Id been lead to believe and as for the bed - I slept like a baby - will be back time and time again to this spot - Many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Chic & nice - good service”
Reviews.Author: Skygirl81
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. I am very fed up with all those "edwardian" hotels that still seem to be part of the London hotel-scene. This was cool and mordern and staff was nice. Bathroom was on the small side, but so are most hotelbathrooms in London these days. Higly recommened if you are young and like a bit of fresh design. Guess that the bad reviews here are from elderly people that dislike a bit of moder design.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: stevev0
Reviews.Content: This is one of those shabby chic hotels but in places it is more shabby than chic.The room we had 203 was very noisy situated on the front of the hotel over looking the main road,the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen with signs of mold around the shower.The room was OK the bed comfortable but kept awake by traffic noise one other small thing was the TV.it was really old and small.Personally I wished that we had payed the extra money to stay at the Rembrandt just up the road although at Â£140 I don't think this hotel was any bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Kensington Glory”
Reviews.Author: Brian1311
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in beautiful London! Ease of access to the tube and small local restaurants made this hotel that little bit easier. Room was small (could just swing my cat), but so to are 80% of the hotels in London. A good hotel to sleep and shower... Almost impossible to have any downtime in the room. Lobby is nice with comfortable chairs and couches. WiFi was free and at a good speed, this was the second hotel my fiancÃ© and I stayed at during our europian adventure and we soon learned how nice it was to have free Wifi. Staff were reserved, seemed as if we were just another customer running through the same process as the last... A little impersonal... But they answered all our questions. Breakfast was nice in a simple but nice atmosphere. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff, decent room and bath”
Reviews.Author: peter49_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very quiet, located close to underground and restaurants - nice place to use as a base for touring London. We felt safe here and in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - and location”
Reviews.Author: Sulla
Reviews.Content: This place has a great location, you couldn't be in a prettier part of town and be so close to everything you need. The single rooms are TINY, and the showers even more so, but they are clean and well-maintained. TV not in a good place to watch when lying down on the bed - you'll get a serious kink in your neck and there's no chair to sit and watch it in. Staff was gracious and pleasant, no problem there. I found it to be cozy as opposed to cramped, and looked forward at the end of each day to going back and resting after all my walking in my quiet, out of the way room. That said, my view out the window was of 3 white walls, not the street, so that's why it was so quiet, but really, I was satisfied with what I paid for, and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “London's shoe box!”
Reviews.Author: WezT
Reviews.Content: We got a discounted rate as my GF had a special rate with work. It was still too much. But then again it is London! Everyone has said how small the room was, I've been in smaller but not by much. The toilet/shower was SMALL. But it worked and the shower was quite comfortable so no complaints there. The bed was very comfy (I'm a big fan of beds!) The staff were friendly too. The breakfast was continental and not great. This is budget London so before you moan about it not being great please remember it's not the Hilton! They probably have a bigger toilet. PS If you don't like noise take ear plugs otherwise you won't sleep at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location poor service”
Reviews.Author: derrita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kensington Rooms hotel for 2 nights in June 2010. It has a superb location, easy to get to Oxford str in 15 min by bus and the nearest tube station is just 4 min on foot, however for a business traveler like myself I must admit that the room I had was just disappointing. Very small room, tiny bed, no airconditioning and no wifi in the room. It faced the main street thus a lot of noise! I should also mention that breakfast was average. Not a good place for families with kids. Might be good solution for budget travellers and youngsters.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel in good area but ..”
Reviews.Author: White-family
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at this hotel whilst attending a concert at the Royal Albert Hall. The tickets for the latter had cost a lot so I searched for a reasonably priced 3 star hotel nearby for approx Â£125.00. Our superior double room (room 200) cost Â£123 through a booking agent, and it was extremely large 25 ft. x 25 ft. approximately, with big picture windows overlooking Courtfield Gardens (and a building site opposite where workmen were about). It had been refurbished we guessed 4-5 years ago and was starting to look a bit tired but was perfectly acceptable for the price. Huge comfortable bed, sofa plus 2 armchairs. Bathroom with excellent shower. The staff are friendly, the public rooms fine although some of the sofas etc needed cleaning or replacing. Location of the hotel excellent - safe, lots of shops, restaurants, pubs, Waitrose, close to lots of museums, Royal Albert Hall etc. The main problem with the Kensington Rooms is that when the refurbishment was done, they did not install air conditioning or have the windows double/triple glazed to shut out the noise on what is basically a main arterial road into London from the west. Therefore even with a room on the side of the hotel overlooking Courtfield Gardens the noise from Cromwell Road was deafening and sleep was difficult. For the comfort of guests, the rooms need re-glazing, preferably triple glazing, but on a hot day/night, you would then need air conditioning. I suppose if you stayed in winter, and at the side of the hotel rather than the front, with the windows closed, the noise might be more acceptable for sleep purposes. Price wise and for the size of the room, the hotel was fine for 1 night but unfortunately there are other issues as above meaning I am unable to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I was mostly disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: bett13
Reviews.Content: My name is Betty Talley. I stayed in your establishment from May 25 to May 29. During that time the toilet was plugged, the sink didn't drain properly, there was no heat to my room and the breakfasts were disappointing, especially toward the end of our stay when the choices became more scarce. The night of the 27th I brought back to my room L120 and two birthday cards. I put them all in my black duffle and closed the flap but did not zip it. I finished packing on the 29th and checked out and flew back to the states. When I unpacked Sunday morning, my cards and my money were missing. Please let me know why they were removed from my luggage and if you will return them to me. I will not be a repeat customer if they are not. Sincerely, B Talley

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice & Friendly, boring breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: SilverGoddess47
Reviews.Content: This is a nice friendly hotel, staff are very helpful. Stayed 3 nights. Arrived really early in the morning and they got me into my room as fast as possible, very much appreciated. Shower was gr8, bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen but adequate. Beds were comfy and it was very clean and our room (which didn't have a gr8 view was very quiet. Breakfast was very boring especially after 3 nights. Great Location close to Gloucester Tube Station, very convenient for Chelsea Flower Show, Harrods and tourist sights of London.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep and location but not much else”
Reviews.Author: kariesue
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research before booking a hotel in London and knew that rooms in London are expensive for very small rooms. I even saw a picture of how tiny the bathroom at this hotel is but was still shocked and distressed upon check-in. Tiny elevator slowly took us to our floor where we had to struggle with 4 fire doors that were heavy and in hallways so narrow we could hardly get our rolling suitcase to not scrape the side walls. The sink in the bathroom was so small that as you washed your face the water fell on your feet as the sink couldnt catch it unless before you splashed your face you leaned over the faucet. The wall in the bathroom had water splash marks, or maybe toothpaste that was never wiped off the whole time we were there. There was a heat wave while we were there and there is no air conditioning, we opened the window but with no fan the air didn't move. The bed was comfortable and the location is great for catching the tube or buses, there are resturants and shops nearby. The breakfast was ok, yogurt, cereal, toast, ham and cheese slices, juice, coffee and tea-the workers worked hard keeping it all stocked but the area was SO SMALL, that their refilling kept people from having access to the food. You could bring your own computer to the lobby area to use internet connection but it was very slow and dropped us several times and when we tried to Skype- our family couldn't hear us becuase others in the lobby were all talking loudly too. If all you need is a place to sleep and are gone all day sight seeing than this would work for you, if you want a room to hang out in, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Room the size of a prison cell”
Reviews.Author: Cazni
Reviews.Content: The room was the smallest room I have ever stayed in, I thought that there was no bathroom until I looked in what I thought was a cupboard to find everything crammed into the tiniest space. The room was also overlooking Cromwell road and the noise was constant all night. There were no curtains only wooden blinds, if it was possible to sleep with the noise you would be woken up at dawn with the light. Would not recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind thin walls...”
Reviews.Author: Trilla81
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the room was the big and comfortable double bed! Unfourtunately it took most of the space in the room leaving no space to pass another person without climbing over the bed. The view was to the back, quiet but ugly, wooden blind was broken and the tv showed mostly blizzard. The bathroom tiles looked new but it seemed that nothing else had been chainged. Otherwise i would have been pretty happy with the room but after we went to bed our neighbour came home; door open, tv on, chatting together - the wall was so thin they could just as well walked straight into our room! I'd recommend that the hotel would add erplugs next to the soap and teabags - they would be much more useful in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close, Convenient, Clean and Classy”
Reviews.Author: honeymooners160110
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during our honeymoon in April. We stayed on the 1st floor and the room had really high ceilings and a nice view of the street corner of Cromwell Road which wasn't noisy. There was a complimentary bottle of wine in our room. Breakfast was nice and had a variety from fruit, pastries, cereals and coffee. It was a 5 minute walk from Gloucester tube station which crossed through 3 tube lines so we always had easy access to where ever we wanted to go. Every morning we picked up the newspapers and a few magazines that were there to take. There is a bus stop (#74) right outside the hotel to take you into town. We bought an Oyster Card which can be used on tubes and buses so we didn't have any problems with getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Crammiest bathroom in London”
Reviews.Author: FinnFrode
Reviews.Content: I understand from some of the other reviews that the rooms vary a lot in size, but what we were offered when we spent two nights at Kensington Rooms back in January was not worthy of a hotel claiming three stars. Our double room was just big enough for the double bed and a desk (without chair), but varying room sizes probably can't be avoided with a hotel inside an old terraced buildig. It would however have been more suitable as a single room. If the room was crammy, the bathroom was a joke. The photo shows most of it - the opening seen at the edge of the picture gives an impression how narrow it was. On the right the toilet, on the left a tiny shower cabin and in the middle a sink. All this squeezed into a strip of space probably no wider than 50 cm. It was so narrow, you could not turn around with the door closed, let alone get dressed. My wife and I are both fairly small people, but anybody supersized would risk getting stuck in there... Except for that the hotel was OK and can't be denied a certain charm. The neighbourhood is sleepy, but across the street we found two Italian restaurants that were both all right. The Gloucester Road tube station is within a few hundred meters with the Circle and Picadilly lines for easy access to City as well as to Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value in good location”
Reviews.Author: martinss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Kensington Rooms with my wife from Thursday through Sunday. The location is excellent, very close to Gloucester Road tube station, which has good connections to three of the main tubelines (Circle, Piccadilly and District lines). Our room had two single beds that were pushed together to form a double, which worked out ok. Room was rather small though, as the beds took up 85% of the floor space. Beds were okay to sleep in, and basic amenities in the room was okay too (tea/coffee, small 14" TV). One drawback was the proximity to Cromwell Road, which is rather noisy no matter the time of day. The noise wouldn't have been a problem if the window in the room had been of a normal quality, but the paperthin glass might as well have been left out, as both noise and a cold breeze was coming in at any time. Service at the hotel was good, and the free luggage-storage after checkout was particularly nice. Breakfast was your average continental with toast, fruit, tea/coffee and croissants - works ok, but not too wholesome. All in all an okay hotel for staying in London, seeing as most of the time you're not in the room anyway on a citybreak like ours.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service...Don't go here if u like hot water!”
Reviews.Author: Tandiaz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is not bad...it's the service that is terrible...we stayed here for two nights and on the first night our hot water was working...we asked if this could be fixed and we were told yes...but in the mean while we could move to another room. So far you are thinking that's not bad service hÃ»h? Wrong...The other room was basically a cupboard! So we decide to stay in our room...since we were told the issue would be fixed the next day...so we go off to dinner come back and go to sleep... The next day ...still no hot water! So at which point we take our showers in a different room...and asked to be given a discount on the final price...which the acting manager agrees... When it comes to our check out...that all changes and they don't want to give us a discount...even though we didn't have hot water (in winter) in our room for two days!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth000
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. I was greeted with a wellcome smile at the arrival and the few days I stayed were pleasant and comfortable. Reception people were friendly. The only thing I did not like about the hotel, perhaps, is the breakfast, particularly coffee, but that is my personal demand. Good place to stay in over a quick business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: arman0
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights ,great location, great value,really cool interiors fantastic hotel! and wish I could have stayed longer! I cannot believe some of the reviews of this hotel, please don't believe a word of it, this hotel is just fantastic! On my last visit stayed in a more expensive hotel in the same area and there is no comparison. My tip is to ask for one of the studios, there huge! and good value!.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: itchanTokyo
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to share with everyone my experience in one of london's best kept secrets. This is the second time I visited London from Tokyo and learned of this wonderful hotel from a friend who had stayed before. The hotel was located close to a an underground station and the friendly staff made me feel welcome. The bedroom was modern spacious and clean and it felt like a design hotel, it was fanatastic. This will be my home in London

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: SSmyth
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this hotel! I am a fairly easy to please person but I can find very little to praise about this place. I was travelling with a group of 14 friends and someone else booked this hotel, had I had a choice I would certainly not have stayed here. The staff were completelty disinterested, the rooms were an ok size, but the bathroom was tiny. No air conditioning so the rooms were very stuffy. Luckily I had a room facing the back, my friends who were at the front of the hotel couldn't sleep cos of the traffic noise. There are FAR better hotels in London for the same price. In short, avoid this at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: PeerNoir
Reviews.Content: When we booked the room, we requested one that was quiet and did not face the main road in front of the hotel. On arrival, we were presented with a very small, yet super clean, quiet and very comfortable room. The window was facing a tiny "backyard", but that's what we asked for. The hotel hasn't got a very high score on tripadvisor, so we were a bit anxious. Fortunately, most of what we read was wrong. The hotel lobby is modern and they have free wi-fi there. The room must also have been quite recently renewed, in our opinion. The king size bed was very comfortable and for the first time ever we didn't need to ask for more pillows! Didn't try the free breakfast, since we always sleep past hotel breakfast time. We stayed for 9 days, and on the first day my girlfriend's bag was stolen in a bar. The staff at the hotel wasn't VERY helpful when we asked about the whereabouts of a police station etc. However, they weren't rude or anything. Some of the staff could do with a course in smiling and service, though. They get a plus for having Gloucester Road tube station within a 4-minute walking distance! But the area around Gloucester Road Station is a bit....ahem...boring and scruffy, and we recommend to walk the 800 metres to Earls Court for breakfast and a pint later on. An exception is the burger joint, "Byron", who served the best burgers we have had in London. All in all, considering the cheap room rate (72Â£/n), when we summarized what's important for us in a hotel, Kensington Rooms fulfilled most of our needs, and because of all the bad reviews we were surprised in a positive way!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: ahern8
Reviews.Content: Picking a hotel 4 our 1st trip to london we were nervous about hotels after our terrible choice of hotel in new york(the carter hotel)!!! however we were more then happy with the kensington rooms! the lobby is modern however the hallways could do with a touch up... our room was much bigger then expected and i loved the spacious feel... the bathrom was expectionally clean and the bathrobes were heavenly! staff werent to friendly or helpful however because of the lack of time we spent there we didnt care.. Other reviews of here says the rooms are tiny and maybe we were just lucky to recieve a large room but i was over the moon! Although not in the city centre its only a few station away from westminister by underground!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, hot and noisy”
Reviews.Author: sigge_sot
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service, clean and OK breakfast - but when there's not aircondition and it's 30 degrees outside the windows have to be open. And the noise from Crowell Rd. is really loud - 24 hours a day... Hard to sleep.... Make sure you book a room away from the Crowell Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Town house hotel that may be worth the money but not more”
Reviews.Author: 1TravelDude
Reviews.Content: Very funny how many different opinions there are about this property. I actually read them before I booked the property for one night. In the end it was not as bad as some of the reviews were but definitely also not as good as some of the better once that were given. I guess you get what you pay for. I stayed the second night at the Milennium Baileys Kensington for the same rate and there was definitely more value for money then at the Kensingtonrooms. My impression of the Kensingtonrooms is an individually managed hotel that tries to get the most out of what is there but does not think of improving it or making the guests stay into an experience. I had a small room and the hall ways are tight and with a lot of different levels, which could give it a very nice town house feel but that does unfortunately not come across as nice as it could.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant staff, clean, bright and well-managed”
Reviews.Author: LeeMallorca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is around 5 minutes walk from Gloucester Rd tube station and being a central hotel there is some traffic noise (of course!) So ignore the feedback about noise - it's not too bad and every hotel in this area has similar feedback on noise. The staff are nice: pleasant, courteous and unobtrusive. The rooms vary as it's an old building. I've stayed twice and the first time the room was smaller. This visit I had a huge room. They're always clean, bright and airy. Breakfast was good for a continental breakfast - croissants, pan au chocolate, toast, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, fruit juice, selection of teas and coffee. There are plenty restaurants nearby (but the ones closest to the hotel are quite expensive for drinks). Walk to Gloucester Rd for a better selection - I can recommend Med Kitchen or if you want something closer the Thai place across the road from the hotel on Cromwell Rd is reasonable and their Thai Green Curry was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Funky cool affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: su920
Reviews.Content: This place was cool, I booked it on expedia with the flight and got a good deal. I think it was before 2006 that i went but worth reviewing anyway. The location is good, near Hyde park, museums and shops as well as a subway. The layout of the hotel was a bit hard to follow, but i liked the eclectic decor and the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not suitable for business people”
Reviews.Author: pablo_rodriguez00
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel into town, wrongly managed Made a booking for a my clients and unfortunatly a last minute illness made them not to come. Cancelled on the same day, they still charged us the hole amounth of the booking instead of begging human charging a resoneable amounth for the cancellation. Shame not to understand bussiness people travelling all the time dealing with flights conexions, rushing everywhere begging out of home. I am really sorry to say all of this but there's a lack of profesionals able able to understand everyday problems, instead of sticking to a Hotel policies ripping people off. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Awful night!”
Reviews.Author: suzannahw
Reviews.Content: The worse night I have ever spent in a hotel! Very noisy â€“ constant noise from traffic thorughout the night & the windows shook as heavy duty traffic drove by (I kid not) â€“ the walls were so I could snoring from the room next door. Also, a very small room if I laid flat on the floor and reached up, I could touch both walls of the width of the room. For the first time ever in my travels I had to wriggle around the sink to reach the loo on the left and was just about able to manoeuvre myself into the shower....I am 5â€™3â€� and weigh 8 stone (in other word Iâ€™m a short size 10...not very big. Definitely not value for money & would certainly never stay there again. S. Wilson

Reviews.Title: “great location, not so great rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: ryan94
Reviews.Content: stayed for a weekend with my boyfriend. main purpose of the trip was to go to a chelsea match at stamford bridge and for that the hotel was great! close to the tube station and short journey to the centre and the stadium. but rooms were tiny, only a bed in the room. a 'double bed' which was two singles pushed together!! no storage and the ensuite was a matchbox.. great if u dont spend anytime in the room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alice_Gleave
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed here whilst spending the weekend in London. First of all great location. 3 minute walk from Gloucester Rd tube station, 10 minute walk to Kensington high st, 15 minute walk to Kensington Gardens & Hyde park & easy access to all of london on the underground. The hotel itself is contemporary & modern which gives a nice feel & we were nicely surprised. The breakfast is a continental buffet, so you can fill yourself up if you wish although as soon as ending time comes they start clearing the tables. In the rooms they provide tea & coffee etc. The only downside we came across was that the staff certainly aren't the friendliest. Not necessarily rude but no smiles to be seen. Overall good little hotel & perfect for weekends away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and clean, but traffic noise a problem”
Reviews.Author: AmataH
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel twice in the past few months and found it to be better than your average budget hotel. The single rooms are absolutely tiny but smart , fresh-looking and CLEAN, and they are designed to use the small amount of space quite usefully. There has always been plenty of hot water on my visits and the bathrooms have been immaculate, if cramped (but no more cramped than far less clean or modern budget hotels I've stayed at in London). I have found staff to be perfectly nice on both my stays, though I can't comment on the breakfast as I have always been too short of time to stop and eat there. The one drawback is traffic noise from the road outside - it is very loud indeed, but personally it doesn't bother me and I have slept perfectly well when I have stayed there. Something to be aware of, though. All in all, Kengsington rooms feels modern, clean (this is so important in cheaper London hotels, which are often hideous!), well-designed (no flowery bedspreads or old, stained carpet, just simple modern lines, though clearly done on a budget) and not at all bad for the money. The location, near Gloucester Rd tube, is also great. Free wifi in the lobby (and I think this is now extending to some of the rooms) is another bonus.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful”
Reviews.Author: hbd1
Reviews.Content: Room was so small the entire floor space was taken up by the bed. The shower in the bathroom had no shower curtain or door, so everytime you shower, the entire bathroom gets soaked. It was 75 degrees out and the room had no airconditioning and only a tiny tiny window that you could barely open up. The room had a hairdryer, but it was attached to the wall in the corner of the room by the floor so you could use it by the mirror.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures deceiving”
Reviews.Author: cgard
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel following a concert at Earls Court. It served its purpose as an overnight stay but I wouldn't recommend it for anything more than that. We could walk to Earls Court in about 15mins and it's only 5 mins from Gloucester Road tube which are both plus points. The room was tiny, the bathroom old fashioned and tiny. The hotel has obviously received a quick refurbishment to make it appear new and modern but on closer inspection, it's cheap and shabby. I would recommend this hotel if you wanted a quick overnight stay following a night at Earls Court. I wouldn't recommend it for any stay that you were planning to spend any amount of time in the room! Breakfast was continental and ok but the staff seemed particularly unfriendly and unwelcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Elena34Greece
Reviews.Content: We had already booked this hotel and then we read some bad reviews at trip advisor. We found everything quite good and we had a great time there although the lobby of the hotel had nothing to do with the pictures we had seen on the internet site and there wasn't a pool. But the staff were very friendly and helpful, the locaton couldn't have been better and we had a quiet sleep (maybe because our rooms were at the back side of the hotel). Breakfast was OK ( my husband would prefer a larger variety), and the rooms were very clean. Each room had its own bathroom with clean towels eveyday. There were two big supermarkets nearby and the neighbourhood seemed quite safe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting London for tourism and sightseeing. It was a great choice for us ( two couples from Greece).

Reviews.Title: “TRY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: GuessWho2008
Reviews.Content: dont trust any of the photos you see on the website, the hotel is very old and they have just done a quick patch-up job to make it look modern, unfortunatly it doesnt do anything but make the hotel look tacky. they have an elevator but you will end up lugging you suitcase up a million stairs. the staff are rude, not one of them made my family or i feel welcome. the food is terrible and the bathrooms are actually dangerous. the only good thing about the hotel is that its about a 10 min walk to the tube.

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: FAIRY117
Reviews.Content: ive stayed here twice now and found it to be small, claustrophobic and staff rather unfriendly. i was unwell the 2nd time i stayed here and found the room very hard to be in as it was so small and there was no room to move. the location is OK, but i did feel a bit out of the london atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms may suit some people, but....”
Reviews.Author: OZtraveller08_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights. My travel agent recommended it - but I don't understand why. Our room - with King size bed - had almost no storage space and nowhere to sit other than the bed or one upright chair squashed between a wall and what must be an apology for a side table. Almost nowhere to store cases and bags except beside the bed. Bathroom is long and narrow and requires contortionist to use it without opening the door to the main (bed) room. Breakfast is OK. Some staff quite friendly, others not so. Excuses re barman not turning up for work. Overall not impressed and certainly would look elsewhere next time. Earlier this trip we stayed at Premier Inn Putney Bridge - MUCH better hotel which we would recommend. Similar price, lovely area, although a bit further from town.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: anon098
Reviews.Content: Tiny twin room with two small single beds at right angles (as wouldn't fit side by side). Tiny wardrobe with maybe 6 hangers, no other storage space or place for suitcase. Paint peeling off walls because of damp. Tiny shower room with edge of basin across entrance to shower. Water tepid. Black mould spots on ceiling Very loud road noise all night as no double glazing. The room was nothing like the pictures on the website. The bar area, although spacious, was not anything special. Overall, nothing lived up to the hype on the web site which promised wonderful beds and bathrobes - nothing like that in our room. Athough cheap for the area, the room was not worth the money. A most uncomfortable night.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: tswalker226
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a decent location. It was only a few minute walk to the Tube. We walked a lot both day and night and felt safe. It's close to museums and not too far a walk to Kensington Palace. The room is very small and the bathroom is equally small, but it was at least clean. The breakfast certaintly wasn't anything to write home about, but it was ok. I really enjoyed the lounge area outside of the bar. The staff was young and wasn't very helpful with providing information, but we managed. All in all, it was an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JobAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Very unfriendly and rude staff, very small rooms, very small bathrooms, very very bad breakfast. Avoid this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it appears”
Reviews.Author: jo73
Reviews.Content: At first glance this hotel looks lovely - modern, fresh and cool. And it is, the lobby and waiting area are big, spacious and inviting. The rooms however, are tiny. There's just enough room for a bed, and my husband said it was difficult to use the toilet because there was no room to stand in front of it because the sink was in the way! There's no bath, just showers, and the door had fallen off ours. It was also very cold, and our friends said they could hear people through the walls being quite noisy. The hairdryer in our room was strangely located behind the TV so I had to crouch down there to use it. When I complained about the lack of heating, the reception staff were very unhelpful. There were no blankets and they wouldn't bring me any more. For the money we paid, we wished they'd used a bit of the money spent on the fancy lobby furniture on providing something a bit more useful in the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the fresh atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Bhain
Reviews.Content: Ive read some not so good reviews about the hotel so i was slightly worried about my stay! However the hotel was lovely, not so far away from Gloucester street station, the reception had a nice fresh modern atmosphere, very clean white look with fresh flowers. We had a double delux, i read a review that the rooms were small, but the cleanliness of the room compensated. NIce large size bed, although the bathroom was small still had a bath and shower. Staff could have been friendlier but would definitely recommend this hotel and would also stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms But Nice...”
Reviews.Author: SuzieDenver
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel if you plan on spending lots of time around London seeing the sights and spending minimal time in your room. I only stayed for one night on January 29th. The beds were very comfy and the room was extremely tall. I agree with other reviews here that the majority of people who work at the hotel are from other countries and not specifically from London. I am from the US but it was somewhat hard talking to them or asking them questions. To some of the staff - english is their second language. Thankfully they were able to hold our luggage until our room was ready so we could get started on seeing the sights since we were only in London for 1 day. The only thing i wish i knew before staying there was that the closest underground station was Gloucester Road and not the Kensington station. The underground is about 2 - 3 blocks away which is great! It was also nice that there were hair dryers which looked like vacuum cleaners...which is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel room IÂ´ve ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: erljens
Reviews.Content: The Kensington Rooms, Cromwell Road, London, Kensington Period: 7.01.2008-11.01.2008 I booked a twin room at the Kensington Rooms, Kensington, in the vain hope that I could trust the description and the photos displayed over the internet. They had no resemblance with reality. The room I got was 2 by 5 meters, including the ensuite facilities, which totalled less than 1 square meter. Only a contortionist will have a chance of using this convenience. Never again. Erling Jensen Denmark

Reviews.Title: “politeness??”
Reviews.Author: donatella_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a standard double room..it was soooo little!no space at all, we really didn't know where to put our things...then the safe was not working and I really couldnt move on the mini-bathroom!the maids threw away my showercap (why??) without putting there one of the hotel. The room was not dirt, but the dust was never polished away. But the thing I was most surprised with has been the unfriendliness of the staff!! NEVER a smile or a "goodday"!! I am a hotel receptionist too, in Italy, and the first thing we must have is politeness.. I really felt thet these receptionsts didn't care at all about their guests.. Anyway, you pay little... a good thing is the very near piccadilly line station, only a few minutes' walk.

Reviews.Title: “A Great 'Tourist' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jalastin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a eight days in October. The location is amazing - three short blocks from the Gloucester Road station. Starbucks and Tesco right at the tube stop. I liked the contemporary update to the old building. It's a bit of a maiz to get to your room, but the elevator works. Keep in mind that this is a place designed for people who are tourists - meaning, you don't spend a lot of time in your room. The rooms are small - think your first dorm room in college - but they are well kept and nicely designed and the beds are soooo comfortable! The staff are just like anyone else in europe - be nice to them and they are nice to you. The hotel offers free wireless in the lobby area - which is great because you are forced to meet your fellow travellers. If you want an american style hotel - don't stay here. If you want a great European tourist hotel with great amenities and a ton of class - This is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrainneU
Reviews.Content: I happened to get a complimentary stay at Kensington Rooms, 3 girls going to London and despite the reviews we thought better to stay here for free than pay for somewhere else!! we arrived at the hotel and were laughing as we expected it to be a disaster, we had joked about the fact that we would probably have to stand on the beds to get changed etc. When we arrived at reception we were pleasantly surprised, the staff were very friendly and informative and bar area looked pretty cool. When we arrived in our room, we found it to be a very good size with three beds with comfy duvets, a desk and chair, tea making facilities and a good sized bathroom with bath! the room was cleaned every day and fresh towels were provided. Breakfast was fine, cereal, pastries and tea/coffee etc nothing overly exciting but it did the job. Location wise it's great for the tube, circle line and picaddilly lines are on the doorstep and its a lovely 15-20minute walk to knightsbridge where Harrods and Harvey Nicholls can be found. I would happily stay here again - providing I got this room of course!

Reviews.Title: “Covenient”
Reviews.Author: olympics2008
Reviews.Content: Had to go to London on business and chose the hotel primarily for its proximity to my company. Saw the reviews and decided to try it for the reason stated above. Good location near the tube station and plenty of restaurants and supermarkets nearby so that I could get a bite before bed. The tube station is pretty close to the centra which was a bonus when the weekend came and I went into the centre. I found the room OK as well as the staff. The decor was nice so, Im not too sure what the others have experienced. Of course, the price was much higher than what Im used to in the far east but it is London and close to good communication links. The ride from Heathrow was especially fast .

Reviews.Title: “Had a rat!”
Reviews.Author: allingavagen
Reviews.Content: I sayed there with my sister for 4nights. The hotel is located NOT so close but around 7min straight walking from the nearest tube sta. But you gotta walk beside a very noisy smoky heavy traffic road to the hotel. That was the thing we could bear though. When we entered the hotel, there was an inpressive lobby and receptionist with nice suit looking. but the room we've got was astonishing. The bathroom was way too small and the water temp was almost uncontrolable, my sister was getting burnt! I called the reception immediatelely to change our room. It took bloddy long time and while we're waiting for a call for long time, we got A RAT in our bathroom! gosh it was nasty. I called the reception again and strongly asked to change the room. Then we finally got a new room but there're uncountably many steps up and down to the new one. So confusing structure of the building! No lift to the higher level. and The receptionist NEVER come to help us to carry our many luggage. never apologized either! I'd NEVER EVER recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not a place I'd recommend”
Reviews.Author: UkTravelalot
Reviews.Content: I and my colleagues travel a great deal all over the world and this has to be the worst hotel we have stayed in in the past 5 years. There is no air conditioning, it's over a busy main road with no double glazing and windows that don't close properly. Unfortuntately there was no option for accomodation in that area when we booked (Wimbledon was on at the time and hotels full to capacity). Rooms were not kept clean and there were stains on carpets and soft furnishings that I didn't want to investigate too fully. My colleague had a room with no bath plug and the handle of the bathroom door came off in his hand! leaving him securely inside until he managed to jam it back on with toilet paper and escape. The toiletries are the most basic that you can get, which is forgiveable if only it were clean. There is no room service (unless you want an interminable wait for a company that delivers) and no hot breakfast, unless you want to wait 40 mins (this is what we were told on the first day). I am aware that it is only a 3 star, but that doesn't mean that it has to be dirty... I would hate others to think that this is the standard of UK hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: aqualady
Reviews.Content: Booked a 5 night stay after seeing this hotel's website. Twin room required. Two single beds back to back. Bathroom so small you had to walk sideways. Huge step up to the shower. Bed and bedding clean. Paintwork peeling. Bedside tables marked and worn. Radiator filthy. Small dirty cupboard to hang clothes in. 4 coathangers in total. When we asked the maid if we could have more she replied 'I don't think so'. Stayed one night then relocated.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely diabolical room 201. So small you honestly couldn't swing a cat.”
Reviews.Author: Greensleeves043
Reviews.Content: IThis was my third visit to the hotel each time due to lack of availibility in the locality. I had the misfortune of staying in room 201, which was reached by lift and steep stairs. The door opened onto the single bed, which also acted as the telephone table. The bathroom was so tiny that you had to slide under the sink to get to the tolilet. The bed albeit clean linen smelt of stale urine. The response of the front of house receptionist to these issues "I Know.........................."

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Very Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cailinalainn
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, right by the tube. The hotel itself is very nice, modern decor. Our room was comfortable and spacious with a huge double bed. The staff unfortunately are the downfall of this hotel. They are extremely rude and unfriendly. I would consider returning to this hotel though it would be nice to have a smiling face behind the reception for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Odd Stay”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl180
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kensington Rooms in a Single Room for two nights while on the return-leg of my week-long holiday in the UK. Having mastered how to make the most of my stay in this quirky hotel, I have some tips that I think will be helpful to travellers: ~Map the location--Kensington Rooms is within two, easy blocks of Gloucester Rd. Underground, but is not obvious on Cromwell (and no one on the street will be able to tell you where it is.) ~Memorize your way to and from the lift(s) inside the hotel--- You may get lost in the odd maze of hallways and rooms. ~Expect a tiny room and a small shower--- My room, while tiny and oddly shaped, was clean enough and comfortable enough for my taste. ~Bring earplugs--The traffic noise from Cromwell is overwhelming even for those of us who like white noise when we sleep. (This was the most significant problem I encountered during my stay.) ~The people at the front desk are human. Smile at them, treat them with respect, and they will do likewise. I would consider staying at Kensington Rooms again.

Reviews.Title: “perhaps i was lucky?”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here AFTER reading all the reviews- was travelling with a collegue who had booked here and didn't want to be difficult. figured i would put up with one night in this place. My expectations were therefore below zero but i was almost pleasantly surprised. I paid GBP 99 incl breakfast which is not bad for London. The room was OK- nothing fancy but in a modernish design, with at least a duvet and not a dusty blanket and all clean. tiny shower indeed but this is London- you just don't get large rooms- at least not without dropping a few 100 quid. Breakfast was a buffet and was acceptable- no worse than any other British hotel. overall i though it was not a bad deal for what i paid. my main complaint would be the lack of internet in the room but there was free wifi in the lobby. Location-wise, it depends where you have to be in London- it is certainly a little while away from the West End and Soho but the underground is not far away.

Reviews.Title: “A total DUMP - do NOT stay here - bait and switch!”
Reviews.Author: bethology
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. It was dirty, TINY and inconvenient from everything. The bathroom shower was so tiny I practically had to kiss the wall just to get in there. The room was dirty and the front desk was VERY rude. Another reviewer called this place a "bait and switch". I couldn't agree more! The pics look nice, but the hotel doesn't look ANYTHING like them!

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising!”
Reviews.Author: ari28
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed with this "hotel". Was given a room with a huge dip in teh middle of the bed, there was hardly any room to get out of teh bed the room was so small. There was none of the advertised items in the room, there was no curtain on the very large window in the bathroom. I went down to ask could I change rooms. The receptionist gave me 2 otehr keys to see if those rooms were better. They were even worse!!! with the bed up against the wall, in a basement like setting. When I tried to get on with things and asked where was the pool I was told that it was across the street at a cost of 15 stg each. This had NOT been specified on their website! When I showed them the print off of their website they brought out a different page and said I was mistaken. There was no apology for anything. I was wrong despite my evidence to teh contrary. I was treated appallingly and certainly won't return. I cancelled the room and went to the Mariott which was FAB. Although it was reasonable priced there was nothing honest in its website description

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled by the rooms showed on internet!”
Reviews.Author: daisy2vis
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly for the location and offcourse the beautifull rooms. When we got there round 18.00 ( tired from traveling) the lady at reception told us she had no booking for us. Blaming everyone but themselfs for this (--) up. Seeing that is was the week of the chinese new year, they were fully booked, but she would see what she could do. After a half hour waiting she told us she found us a room in the back of the hotel, nice and peacefull. When we opened the door of the room i fell strait on to the bed!! She gave us the bloody broomcupbourd!! The bed was as big as the room...i was to tired to complain. I remember other reviews were people said the beds were very good. That part is true. I saw it as my own fault...in the future when asked if i have any prefrences, apart from a non smoking room with bath, i shall ask for a room bigger than a closet!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OzzyDave”
Reviews.Author: OzzyDave
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Kensington Rooms four times over the last few years and would recommend it to anyone. Is it the Singapore Hilton? No it's not - nor does it cost anywhere near as much. It's a 3.5 star hotel in the middle of London and it is very good value for what it is. I have always found the rooms to be clean, comfortable and stylishly decorated if small. I think there is considerable variability in the style of room - each time I've stayed the room has been completely different! Gloucester Road tube is five minutes walk away, buses go past the front door, the marvellous Natural History Museum is just down the road, as is Harrods and many other attractions. It is also in a beautiful part of London if walking around the area is your thing!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!! Never Again - Website is used to bait and switch in my opinion!”
Reviews.Author: GladysAlberta
Reviews.Content: Room was small - but I expected that. Room rate of Â£55 per night, expected small but clean and safe. The fact that many of the facilities advertised, such as satellite TV, where not present was not the problem either. Both websites for the hotel (------- and --------) show only 3 types of room: Urban, City and Town. The hotel actually has standard rooms which are not anywhere near as good as the others look on the website. Door didn't have a door chain/deadlock so I felt vulnerable. Mattress leant to one side. There was no light fitting at all in the ceiling, simply a standard bedside lamp which was held together with black duct tape. Very noisy room as well as it was on the front of the hotel, over the Cromwell Road which is a very busy road. I've stayed at all sorts of hotels, from B&B's, 2*s to 5*s and cruises both on business and pleasure over the years and this has to be the worst experience I've had. The only thing going for this place in my view is its location, which is great for the museums and Kensington area. Its also basically clean as well, although if you've got any health problems don't stay here as you are more than likely going to have to lug your luggage by yourself along long corridors and up stairs (as I found out for myself). It was so bad I decided I couldn't stay one night, so upgraded to the Copthorne Tara instead, which was excellent. If you do decide to stay here, make sure you don't get caught out by the deceptive website - make sure you ask for, and get, an Urban, City or Town room. If it doesn't specify on your booking, you'll almost certainly be in a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY LOUSY STAY”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNg
Reviews.Content: Booked one of the largest studio room (6 Nites) for our honeymoon. Upon checking in, dust all over the sofas, the TINY TV, bed, headboard, sides tables, lamps and etc. Worst of all, found a half rotten apple under the sofa. Top portion of bed linen was torn and sewn in a rough manner. Heater not fully working. Compliant to the front desk and they promised to instruct the house keeping personally for a spring cleaning. When the h. keepper arrived, she know nothing! So we have to instruct her area by area. SHOULD WE BE DOING THAT?? Told the front desk and all they do is 'sorry' ! A lower star rating hotel are far better attitude then them. Ask to change room due to heater not fully working even after repair. Said to check and call back but didn't till we ask them. The reply is 'sorry fully book' . The girls in the front desk literally not interested. Asked the front desk to confirm our airtickets and as usual they took the tickets. To our surprised when we are back, the girl just says the number printed on our schedule slip are engaged at all times. (WHAT A STUPID ANSWER! CAN'T THEY GET ANY OTHER CONTACT NUMBER BESIDE WHAT IS ON OUR TICKETS!!!!) Again just a sorry and nothing else. We compliant to the manager on the tickets and dust and rotton apple and all He do too SORRY! What a incompetent team of staffs. Sincerely, i hope the owner of this hotel read this review. And indeed I suggest you DO A THROUGH 'SPRING CLEANING'!! Christopher (Singapore)

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny single room”
Reviews.Author: HI3
Reviews.Content: The reception and bar area were quite nicely done and check in was efficient, so we had high hopes. However, I had been booked a single room by my company which turned out to be the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. It was a tiny part of a once much bigger grander room, with a single bed forced up against a lovely huge window, with about half a meter walking space on one side of it. It kind of felt like I was sleeping on the windowsill of a bay window! The ensuite bathroom was even smaller, you had to tuck your legs under the sink to sit on the loo! My colleage had a double room which she said was fine, so splash out that extra 20 quid if you're going to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Ki18
Reviews.Content: My trip to London was arranged in a 'hurry' and this was the only hotel that was directly available. Considering the price, I find it a good price/quality ratio. I was kind of frightened of what the hotel would look like after reading these reviews, because I'm used to staying in upper class hotels. But I found it was a nice, clean (!) hotel. I wouldn't stay there for more then two days, 'cause the rooms are really very tiny, and it's quite hard to handle your luggage in such a narrow space... But for a short trip its ok. Don't count on the staff to give you any kind of 'tourist info', cause they hardly speak any English, and I doubt if they even have an idea of what London is all about. If you know your way around, and are just looking for a comfy (!) bed in a clean environment, this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Hoax - Scam - Smallest Room Ever Witnessed”
Reviews.Author: Preller
Reviews.Content: Don't let the Hotel pages on the internet fool you. I have stayed in hotels accross the world for the past 6 years, but have never experienced something like this. The room was a cubicle, 2m x 3, smaller than a jail cell like the ones you see in the movies. Both the shower and the main door when opened bumped against the bed. The Tv, the screen of which is as big as an ipod video player was 45 degrees positioned on the right hand side of the bed, anyone whatching TV from the bed will wake up with a serious neck injury. I still struggle to plan how to iron a pair of jeans in the room because there is simply no space for an iron board. This all for 150 gbp per night, the owners need to be exposed for misleading travellers with the hoax they create on the hotel internet pages. When I complained about the room the front manager agreed that the room is "very" small but that there were no other rooms available and that the ones that might be available the next day might be booked, also that if I cancel a cancellation policy will apply. Surely the London tourism board that grade hotels need to start looking arround, there are simply too many jail cells in London, classified as hotels. NEVER AGAIN at this hotel it is simply a waste of money and TERRIBLE!, what a nightmare after 19 hours on a plane.....economy class for 19 hours on BA was 20 times more relaxing, if I had a choice I would have stayed on the plane!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Staff Rude Arrogant Ignorant Terrible the Worst! Ever! Dont Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: lovesthewestinNY
Reviews.Content: On the date 27/09/06 i booked a room on lastminute.com for one night at the Kensington Rooms Hotel on Cromwell Road, this night was for 28/09/06. Today i went to the hotel to check in. Upon arrival myself and my patiner recieved strange looks from the staff but just thought nothing of it. We entered the room and the bed sheets were ripped, the toliet was filthy and had residue left. We were horrified and felt very annoyed. I contacted reception and the staff were abrupt and rude-they hung up after saying they would send cleaners. I went down to the reception and asked to change the room or recieve a full refund. The lady at reception told me i was being silly and theres nothing wrong with the rooms, i felt so annoyed and disgusted at their behaviour towards me, they were laughing, abrupt and rude. I told her the customers always right and she should listen to me and she replied 'No the customer is not always right' this type of comment is completly unacceptable! The lady would only offer us another room, we checked the other room and it was just as bad. This hotel is 3* but clearly is not, but most of all the people of reception should even be able to work. They seemed to be racist and unfair. The lady would not offer a refund! I felt so let down and totally confused, she was defensive and silly. All the receptionists were laughing and being totally rude. I contacted lastminute.com and recieved understanding, and efficent customer service, they listed to me and promised a refund. I just feel you need to know and definatly look in to this as they should not be allowed to work there. I thank you for your time to listen. As followed are the hotels details. THIS LETTER I SENT TO TRADING STANDARDS!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - I cannot recommend it”
Reviews.Author: D037386
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel was fine as well as reception and entrance. The gym costs 20 addional pounds per day. The room was extremely small (one foot step from bed to bath room). The bath room was not new and not very beautyful decorated or refurbished. The window was damaged and we could not open it. The bath room was covered with hairs from other visitors before us. Breakfast was ok but the took our plates at 10am and we got not any coffee any more. I never saw something like that before. ONe day we had no warm water for the shower and they said that the don't know when this will be fixed. The hotel stuff is extremely unprofessional - it seems that those are students working there beside school. I completed 3 complaint forms - I personally think it flew right away to the rubbish. I would not recommend to stay in this hotel. It is not horrible but I think there are much better alternatives for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: max15
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel I was looking for certain things ie: air con, bath and so on. When we arrived there was NO air con, had to fight for another room with a bath and no full English breakfast like it was stated. When I spoke to the hotel they had a, I don't care attitude. I was told to contact the people at the agency. Adding to this the rooms are minute and the bathrooms even smaller. For the money I spent it was a rip off. Suggestion, don't stay there. There are other problems I can write about, but there is not enough space.

Reviews.Title: “Classic bait and switch.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place shouldn't be allowed to operate due to deceptive practices. I was told by staff that the place has improved because 6 months ago they used to average 20 complaints a day, now they're down to 10. I asked to be moved, so got to see 3 rooms- basically closet sized. No resemblance to what is on the website. Most rooms face the 4 lane Cromwell Road, so no quiet warm summer nights when the window has to be opened. And forget about taking a shower between 8-9am because there is no running water.

Reviews.Title: “How totally disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay at the Kensington Rooms hotel for almost two weeks however when I arrived (after lugging all our luggage up the stairs to our room - have these people ever heard of porters?!?) I couldn't wait to get out of there! We had a twin room booked and the room was so small that they couldn't put two single beds side by side. Instead they were head to head with only a small amount of room on one side that was taken up by our luggage (seeing as though the closet was small and had a strange odour to it, I didn't want to put my clothes in there). And then I discovered the bathroom.... oh my god! It was so small that I couldn't even stand in there with the door closed. My knees knocked on the basin when I sat on the toilet, and the getting up into the shower was like climbing a mountain! The toilet roll was hooked up on the hairdryer and the towels were like sandpaper.
