There was no alarm clock, no fridge, no iron and ironing board, no curtains and the TV was so small that you needed a microscope to see it properly. And I actually don't think I have room in this review to go through the ordeal of trying to get an external line for the telephone - I just thank god that the hotel next door was able to provide a public phone. I had looked forward to this trip for months but after arriving at the hotel was totally disappointed. We moved to the Thistle Kensington Gardens and had the most amazing experience there. I would recommend that you pay a little extra (not much) and you will appreciate the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel with minimal expectations, we knew London was expensive, the rooms are small and that the pictures of Kensington Rooms overs-sold the hotel....but it was still a disappointment. Our biggest complaint was the smell from the bathroom. Everytime we flushed the toilet or ran the sink a horrid garbage smell came up the drain. The bed was comfortable, and overall the room was clean - it works for a traveller not spending much time in the hotel and not looking to spend much $$$.

Reviews.Title: “A truly miserable experience”
Reviews.Author: yamana
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights in a triple room at the hotel for a short London break. Arrived and given the key - on entering the room, someone elses stuff was there! Back to reception - confusion but little in the way of an apology. However, eventually given three rooms instead. Beds OK, rooms adequate for the price. Breakfast was mediocre with cheap bread. The next night we were told we could have the triple room - opened the door and the third bed had gone! Back to reception - more confusion, so given an additional room. OK, except the shower came off the wall whenever the power setting was used!! The hotel looks as if it ought to be fine and is in a decent position. However, it suffers from having absolutely no management at all and it shows. I would suggest that if you are thinking of staying at this hotel, don't. It is mediocre in the extreme and even the low prices do not justify its existance.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked into Kensington Rooms based on the various 'good' reviews from other sites and the concept on which the hotel was based. On checking in , I was shocked to find that not only was the term 'concierge' non-existent, the reception staff also did not offer any assistance apart from shrug her shoulders. Having travelled from overseas, I had to haul my own baggage - i.e. 1 x 25kg suitcase, 1 x trolley bag with laptop, 1 x hand baggage - up the narrow stairs and corridors (hotel concept) whilst the staff stood there and stared. Not ideal if you are travelling along. Room was large and rather funky - at the expense of the tiny bathroom. Hot tap spat hot water all over the bathroom and shower head did not function well. Though, the one good thing I have to say is that the bed was comfortable. However, if you wanted to order room service, you'd be hard pressed to find a room service menu in the room. But as the hotel is located very centrally, you can find alternative dining options quite easily. Overall, I'd say it was a disappointment as the hotel has the potential to do quite well with its concept.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You need to be five foot or less, alternatively use a lubricant to get in these rooms! The location of the hotel is OK though. Blackpatch

Reviews.Title: “Never again in Kensington Rooms Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days in KRH with my family. Before I booked I e-mailed we will arrive with a baby, we need a crib. When we arrived in the room,I was totally disappointed. No crib, narrow room, facing to a firewall!!!Finally we got a crib, but it was dirty, we decided not to use it. When we opened the window, cigarette smog came in the room from the neighboor, and the air condition of the hotel's kitchen was next to our window, so it was very loud. The breakfast was very poor!!! And the staff unpolite. All these for Â£107 per day!!!!! Never again in Kensington Rooms Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, but lacking”
Reviews.Author: Sazzar
Reviews.Content: Kensigton Rooms offers comfy rooms with very nice beds and pillows, but lacks class in many areas. For example, the bathroom flooded every morning due to poor ventilation and inadequate shower screens. The walls in our room were extremely thin, as we were kept awake by our neighbour watching television and having loud phone conversations at 4am, 2 nights in a row. The biggest problem we had was with reception. We told them that we were expecting a phone call under a different name than the booking, and they proved unable to take a message. This was extremely disappointing. Overall, we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bubble Busted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had great hopes for this from its pictures, but my bubble was busted when I arrived in the room. I had a single room and it was tiny. I am not a large female but I had to literlly squeeze into the bathroom--it was the size of a small broom closet. Their customer service skills were lacking also. As I made my way to my room there was an employee standing by the entry door into the room area and she did not even open the door for me seeing that both my hands were full with lugguage. I thought it might just be me, but I observed this same employee do the same thing to another guest who had just checked in after I had, and she had lugguage twice the size of mine. Not a hotel that I will book with again.

Reviews.Title: “kensingtonrooms is a gem well done!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: recommended to book the kensingtonrooms by friends who had stayed there during august and september i booked a room for 3 nights on the 25th october 2005 and was so pleased with the interior decor of the hotel and friendliness of the staff. it really is a gem in london. I fully intend to spread the word i just hope they have rooms available as it seemed very busy!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear!! What a Shambles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having been advised by numerous people that the Kensington Rooms was extremely BELOW Par - i decided to see for myself. How right they were!! The place is a disgrace, the adverts on the website are completely misleading advising of Air Conditioning, Mini Bar, etc - Unless i was blind i couldnt see / feel them. The Noise in the bedroom was horrific and kept me awake all night - Due to the fact that i had to keep the window open to keep cool. Poor Show!! The beds are two pushed together so i was always moving positions to keep me from falling in between!! And the Breakfast, Continental - Really!! the Crossaints were stale, i had to wait 15 minutes to get some toast! The Selection of cereals looked like they had been sat there for weeks. So i decided to get something else to eat when i left to fill me up.. Overall a complete waste of money and i would advise ANYONE! to look and stay elsewhere!! - Do NOT be fooled by the misleading website!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: SANLUQUEï¿½ï¿½A
Reviews.Content: I booked that hotel because it seemed by the web site to be contemporary and recently refurnished. I hate old hotels! I payed even an extra to get an "executive" room with complete bathroom and a king size bed. When we arrived we got a small room, the king size bed was two beds pushed together, and the bathroom was tiny and from the 70's, not ever restored (you won't find pictures of it in their web). Instead of having a bath it had only a mini shower. We complaint to the recepcionist, since I wouldn't have paid an extra if I had known that. They told me first that there was no other room available and that all of them were similar. After a long time waiting they finally gave us another room which had a bath, but the same size. The king bed was still two beds. So please, don't belive what they say in the web site. There's no city or town room, all of them are the same, and the only goodies are a shampoo and shower gel (no bathrobes). The money spent was not worth!

Reviews.Title: “Not completely awful”
Reviews.Author: elizabarry
Reviews.Content: After reading recent reviews, I was fearing the Kensington Rooms would be a dump. It's not, but it does suffer from poor design and management. Our agent booked us a triple there, with the information that the room would be air conditioned and have a small fridge. None of the rooms has a/c or a fridge, or so I was told by hotel staff after we arrived. Our first room was in the basement just next to the Cromwell Road -- the noise was unbelievable. Plus, the bathroom, though large, had not a single bar or hook on which to hang a towel, only one small glass shelf over the sink for toiletries, and no shower curtain or guard whatsoever. After a sleepless night, we insisted on a different room and got one looking out on an air shaft that was at least quiet. The bathroom in this room had one hook and a towel rack, a shower guard, plus a deep window shelf where we could place things. The designer of this hotel clearly valued form over function. The room furniture consisted, beside the beds, of a few small modular tables, a chair or stool, and a wardrobe with just a hanging bar -- no desk or drawers or anything on which to place a suitcase. The designer and managers should be sentenced to share one of the rooms for a week. A friend joined us one night and got the tiniest room and bathroom I have ever seen. But, she got a remote for her t.v., which neither of our triples had. After the friend left with my daughter, my son and I had booked (and prepaid) a double for our last two nights. But the hotel claimed it couldn't find the booking and sent us to the Sussex Gardens, which makes the Kensington Rooms look posh. On the upside, the triples at the Kensington Rooms had 3 full-size beds instead of the usual two beds and a cot, the rooms were reasonably roomy, the beds were comfortable, and the breakfast was fine, certainly better than most "English breakfasts" I've had in the UK, plus the coffee was drinkable. The location is good, also, as the Gloucester Road tube station is on the Central, District and Picadilly lines. I wouldn't recommend this place, but you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “At the moment this is a one star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At the moment this is a one star hotel. Class and style are pleasing on the eye but good manners and service are paramount too. When you pay for a hotel, you pay for the service. The basics of that service - according to the rating of the hotel, should provide the customer with comfort and care. I'm not sure what the internal problems are at The Hotel Kensington Rooms, but whatever it is they should all sit down and talk about it. The staff are rude in general which is always a sign of bad moral and a lack of team work. My room seemed to be designed so that I could hear every word that came from next door, not to mention other noises. The shower needed a good scrub, what's the point in washing in dirt. The breakfast was like cardboard, and I was charged for my breakfast tray being brought to my room (the charge was the same price as the breakfast) without being advised orally or by any literature, although I did see something about an optional charge. This hotel is a potentially nice place, it's very trendy and stylish and obviously makes good income from renting conference space. I requested a talk with the manager, but he was too busy to see a customer. My desire to ever stay there again is none existent.

Reviews.Title: “bollocks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Personally, I wouldn't even give this hotel 1/5. It was absolutely awful. Myself and two friends decided to take a three day break from studying and working (we are 18 yo students, so not much money) and treat ourselves for once. As we walked in the door, there were around 4 or 5 females on the desk who proceeded to look us up and down as if we were a pile of ----. Eventually, we got up to our *triple* room on the third floor. This included two single beds which looked lovely with their big duvets and cushions. Then, the third bed was nothing more than a fold up-fold down camping bed with sheets .. yes, sheets. No duvet. We thought we would relax and have a cuppa and drink and watch TV for half an hour before hitting the streets. Wa hey - only two coffee cups and no drinks in the *mini bar* (a tiny little fridge which was unplugged). There was also no sattelite television as advertised. When we decided to go out, we wanted to put our passports in the safe. You guessed it, there was NO safe. We asked at reception where it was and were told it was in the wardrobe. When we said we had checked there she hastily looked on the computer and said your room does not have a safe you can leave your valuables at reception. Hmmm.. no thanks. So, we came back to get showered and things before going out only to find there were only two towels. We then had to phone down to reception and wait for the third towel to be brought up. We wanted to iron our clothes as they had been in our rucksacks, there was also no iron as advertised. We asked where Kensington High Street was and were given directions which were no where near right. The breakfast was crap. The croissants were semi-stale and the fruit juice was warm. The staff were very hostile and VERY rude. They were most unwilling to help bar one asian guy who wasn't too bad. He was the only one who smiled. The girls constantly gave us dirty looks and whispered. It was horrible - DO NOT GO HERE. In-Room Facilities: Ensuite - the bathroom was dirty, shower was mouldy but it was there. Direct-dial telephones - was present. Modem connection - sorry, where? Satellite television - Not that I saw. Iron and ironing board - If there was, we couldn't find it. In-room safe - Only at reception.. but wait.. that's not actually in our room.. Mini Bar - It's mini.. it's a fridge.. it's a mini -fridge.. not a mini bar. Hairdryer - Took around an hour to dry your hair but yes.. it was a dryer.. for your hair. Bathrobes - There was one.. for three people. Not even enough for an arm each! =p. Stay clear people!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as other reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Chilli_the_pink
Reviews.Content: Having read these reviews before arriving at the Kensington rooms hotel i was really very pleasantly surprised. The decor was modern and the beds were very comfortable. The room was small but if you are only paying Â£65 per night for two of you, then the size of the room was perfectly adequate. The breakfasts were fine, coffee, croissants, cereal, yogurts, juices...although only Raspberry Jam! The situation is excellent with Gloucester road tube and the major Childrens Museums 10 minutes walk away. My daughter loved the cool settees and seats in the loung and also the aquarium. The one thing that did let us down was the noise from the Traffic.....complimentary ear plugs would have been lovely. Ask for a room at the back or at the side never the front. If you are used to the US sizes and the Have a nice day style of American chains, then you wouldnt be advised to stay here as its very european.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible garbage of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by the most impolite staff imaginable (see other reviews also??). Rooms were tiny, "king size double" was in fact two single beds pushed shabbily together! Safe in room broken, no light through window (view of a wall anyway), shower broken and scalded girlfriend when it did work, complementary shampoo half used upon arrival!!! Empty wine glasses and coke cans left lying in corridor for two days! On third night went out for dinner and upon return was told reception had lost our room key (waited 35mins to get back in and no apology!). Concept of handing in key to incompetent staff ridiculous! THIS IS NOT A ONE STAR LET ALONE A FOUR STAR!!! TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY! WILL NEVER SUGGEST ANYONE VISITING THIS RUBBISH

Reviews.Title: “Not what it says on the tin. . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From looking at the hotel website, I thought that the Kensington Rooms was the ideal place to stay in London. Whilst the reception area and bar are of a reasonably high standard I was disappointed to find that behind the 'hip and contemporary' front end, the hotel was of an exceptionally poor standard. I would rate this no more than a very poor 3* hotel. I stayed in a City Room on the 4th floor. The bedroom looked like it had been 'done up' on the cheap to give it a modern feel. The room itself smelt stale and I wasn't convinced that the bedding had even been changed from the previous guests! The tiny bathroom was possibly one of the worst hotel bathrooms that I have ever seen. The sink in the bathroom was dirty and some of the fittings had gone rusty. The 'power' shower was simply a trickle of water, the shower screen wouldn't close and the complimentary shower gel had already been used! Luckily I wasn't disturbed by traffic as I was staying at the back of the hotel facing away from the main road - I was however woken at midnight by 20 seconds worth of fire alarm. The inclusive breakfast is again possibly one of the worst that I have ever seen. The entire buffet includes, bread, croissant, 2 choices of cereal, apples (red/green) and warm yoghurt with a choice of tea / coffee OR fruit juice. Alternatively you could pay over 6 for a bacon sandwich! I'm glad that I didn't pay the advertised rate of 200 per night!

Reviews.Title: “RUDE and CHEATS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kensington Rooms double book people and put their 'SPARE guest' in their other hotels so they can make as much money as they possibly can. I recently went to london with my girlfriend and booked to stay at the Kensington Rooms. But when I arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by building work as soon as we stepped in. When we got to the check in desk, we had to stand there for 5 mins while the two staff were chatting away in a different language. When one of them decided to serve us, he didnt not say sorry or hello. He just asked for my name and told us that we have to leave as they have double booked us so they have transferred us to their 'sister hotel' in Marble Arch. We didnt even get a sorry or an reason why they didnt contact us before hand. When we arrived to the Royal Sussex Hotel, it was in Paddington NOT Marble Arch. They Royal Sussex was dirty and old. It looked like it hasnt been cleaned for a while. The door to our room was kicked in, the sheets were dirty and covered in grease. The bathroom had hair in the sink and shower. In the end we decided to book our own hotel out of our own pockets as kensington rooms were not help us. The service in both hotels were poor and the staff do not speak a word of english. Overall, AVOID these two places.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel ??? 4 Falling Stars !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked 5 nights in the hotel but after 1 night i decided to leave as soon as possible and stayed the rest of the nights in another hotel. The rooms are so small you can't even walk, the bed linen was not changed!, there was no light and they had a problem with the water supply in the hotel so i couldn't even take a shower! I asked several times for another room but the hotel was overbooked. People that asked for a double room were forced to stay in a single room. It was just horrible!! I advise not to stay in the Kensington Rooms hotel because it is not worth your money!!!

Reviews.Content: I have had such a bad expirience, that only have worlds like, Santa is laughing of the website of this noisy, horrible staff, and unhealthy matress ...god !! , itÂ´s a bad joke the way they sell the rooms desing, just canÂ´t belive it !!! Please, you can have a lot better Hotel for the money they ask, just TERRIBLEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!

Reviews.Title: “just Okay”
Reviews.Author: clareta
Reviews.Content: I have to say that our room was right but the bathroom was really small. The recepcionist was really rude. Too expensive for what it really is.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay in London was almost ruined by the treatment we received at this hotel. Upon check-in we were greeted by a very indifferent gentleman who practically threw the booking form at us, making no eye contact or conversation. We were given a key for room 006 and instructed to go "downstairs". As we were already on the ground floor, we knew it was not a good sign. A 10 minute hunt for the room ensued, with us returning to reception and asking for precise directions... the gentleman sniggered, and sent a girl to show us the way. She told us that we could not take the usual route, as there was a meeting on in one of the rooms. Normally we would have to walk through this media room... So down a flight of steep stairs with our suitcases, through a bathroom area, down a dirty staff corridor with old furniture stacked up against the walls, and voila.. room 006 ! We entered, and yes the room was large, with nice bed etc. but when the blinds were open, we were greeted with a view of a stone stairs and peoples feet waking on the street overhead. Blinds remained shut for rest of stay. When we noticed the shower head didnt hang up anywhere, it just sat in the bath, we rang and asked someone to have a look at it. The same rude check-in man came down and basically said "whats the problem, this is normal". We asked to be moved and he said no we are full and left. The next morning, we went to reception again and a new indifferent man said no we are full, nothing we can do. He told us "there are a lot worse rooms - you should be happy". We mentioned the shower, street noise and the fact that there was no tea/ coffee facilities in the room. He stared blankly and said we will not be moving you. We left again, fuming. That night we returned from sightseeing, and i asked the initial rude gentleman for a cup of tea.. after much confusion, he said he would have it brought to room.... 1hour 30mins and two phone calls to reception later we never got the tea. Worst service ever in a hotel... 4 star? I think not. Didn't even have the basics, never mind any extras. Do not disappoint yourself by booking this hotel - we will never return.

Reviews.Title: “This is a load of rubbish indeed!”
Reviews.Author: chicagoborn40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad if you don't mind waking up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom and having to kill roaches while on the toilet! Also, the bizarre practice of not giving you a receipt noting that you have paid the bill at the end of your stay. The bizarre girl at the front desk who, upon check in would not allow my husband to look at the paperwork that I just signed to check us into the hotel. What's more this same incompetent, checked us out of our room one afternoon while we were out. The hotel's policy is to hand in your key before you leave to go out everyday. It's held at the desk and you can collect it when you come back each time. However, this ditz checked us out when we left one day (mind you, we were not carrying luggage of any kind when we handed her the key) and gave us our key when we returned. We couldn't get into our room, went downstairs to ask what the problem was, and was told, "Oh, I thought that you had checked out." We asked her why she thought that, and her answer was a peculiar, "I don't know." and a blank, distracted, vacant look. Avoid this place and don't believe the photos. They only apply to the lobby area. Save afew bucks and go to the Best Western Phoenix. Ask for the loft room which sleeps 3 as an upgrade.
